statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Elton Nesbitt scored 14 points to lead Georgia Southern to a 69-57 victory over Western Carolina on Wednesday in the first round of the Southern Conference tournament.
article.headline: Georgia Southern will play UNC-Greensboro
article.linkText: Nesbitt leads Georgia Southern in Southern tourney
article.story:
CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. (AP) -- Elton Nesbitt scored 14 points to lead
Georgia Southern to a 69-57 victory over Western Carolina on
Wednesday in the first round of the Southern Conference tournament.

	   Georgia Southern (18-12) will play UNC-Greensboro in the
quarterfinals Thursday.

	   Rans Brempong led Western Carolina (8-22) with 13 points and 11
rebounds.

	   The Golden Eagles led by as much as 53-34 in the second half,
and the Catamounts never got closer than 35-26, when Antonio
Russell opened the half with a 3-pointer.

	   Georgia Southern went on a 13-4 run to pull away from a tie game
midway through the first half, and took a 35-23 lead into halftime.

	   It was the Golden Eagles' first win this season when they scored
less than 70 points.

	   Jean Francois scored 13 points for Georgia Southern, and Louis
Graham added 10.

	   Trey Hopkins added 11 points, with eight coming on free throws.
